Foto Anies Baswedan Jadi Joker, Ade Armando Diadukan ke Polisi
01 Nov 2019, 13:01 by M Yusuf Manurung, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anggota Dewan Pimpinan Daerah atau DPD RI, Fahira Idris, melaporkan dosen Universitas Indonesia, Ade Armando, ke Polda Metro Jaya. Fahira mengadukan Ade karena mengedit dan mengunggah ke media sosial Facebook foto wajah Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan dengan makeup ala tokoh antagonis dalam DC Comics, Joker.
"Laporan ini dibuat karena saya percaya bahwa koridor hukum adalah satu-satu cara yang harus kita tempuh jika melihat adanya dugaan pelanggaran hukum," kata Fahira di Polda Metro Jaya, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Fahira menggunakan Pasal 32 Ayat 1 juncto 48 ayat 1 Undang-Undang Nomor 19 Tahun 2016 tentang Informasi dan Transaksi Elektronik (ITE) dalam pelaporan itu. Pasal tersebut berbunyi, setiap orang dengan sengaja dan tanpa hak atau melawan hukum dengan cara apa pun mengubah, menambah, mengurangi, melakukan transmisi, merusak, menghilangkan, memindahkan, menyembunyikan suatu informasi elektronik dan atau dokumen elektronik milik orang lain atau milik publik.
Menurut Fahira, foto Anies yang diunggah oleh Ade merupakan dokumen milik Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta atau milik publik yang diubah menjadi seperti Joker. Dalam foto itu pula, Ade menuliskan kalimat 'Gubernur Jahat Berawal dari Menteri yang Dipecat'. "Dalam gambar itu, Gubernur DKI Jakarta mengenakan pakaian dinasnya," kata dia.
Film Joker sendiri rilis pada awal Oktober lalu. Film ini menggambarkan seorang penderita pseudobulbar affect yang tersakiti oleh orang yang dicintainya, teman, lingkungan sosial dan sistem yang ada di Kota Gotham sehingga akhirnya menjadi penjahat.
text:
Anies Baswedan Photo Becomes Joker, Ade Armando Reported to the Police
01 Nov 2019, 13:01 by M Yusuf Manurung, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Member of the Regional Leadership Council or DPD RI, Fahira Idris, reported a lecturer at the University of Indonesia, Ade Armando, to the Metro Jaya Regional Police. Fahira complained to Ade for editing and uploading to social media Facebook photos of the face of DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan with the makeup style of the antagonist in DC Comics, Joker.
"This report was made because I believe that the legal corridor is the only way we have to go if we see allegations of violations of the law," Fahira said at the Jakarta Metropolitan Police, Friday 1 November 2019.
Fahira used Article 32 Paragraph 1 juncto 48 paragraph 1 of Law Number 19 of 2016 concerning Information and Electronic Transactions (ITE) in the reporting. The article states, every person intentionally and without rights or against the law in any way to change, add, reduce, transmit, damage, delete, move, hide an electronic information and or electronic documents that belong to other people or public property.
According to Fahira, Anies's photo uploaded by Ade was a document owned by the Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta or publicly-owned, which was changed to be like a Joker. In the same photo, Ade wrote the phrase 'Evil Governor Starting with the Fired Minister'. "In that picture, the Governor of DKI Jakarta is wearing his official attire," he said.
The Joker film itself was released in early October. This film depicts a sufferer of pseudobulbar affect who is hurt by his loved ones, friends, social environment and systems that exist in Gotham City and eventually become a villain.
